result.purpose: This project is a wallet manager for decentralized applications (dApps) that facilitates user authentication, manages announcements, and handles device interactions. It aims to provide a secure and efficient platform for users to manage their digital assets and interact with various blockchain services.
result.architecture: The project follows a modular architecture pattern, utilizing a service-oriented approach for managing different functionalities such as user authentication, announcements, and device management, while employing a repository pattern for database interactions.

.github.purpose: Contains templates and configurations for GitHub workflows, including pull request templates.
.github.architecture: The folder follows a simple structure focused on providing templates for GitHub interactions, promoting consistency in contributions.

.github/pull_request_template.md.purpose: Template for pull requests to outline changes and checklist items.

.github/workflows.purpose: This folder is responsible for defining GitHub Actions workflows for various automation tasks including security checks, Docker builds, and release management.
.github/workflows.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern where each workflow file encapsulates specific automation tasks and can import other workflows as needed.

.github/workflows/check.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for security checks and builds on pull requests to the develop branch.
side_effects: Triggers a security scan on pull requests
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if the workflow is misconfigured

.github/workflows/dockerize.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for Dockerizing a mobile wallet manager.
side_effects: Triggers Docker build process on specified events
risks: Exposure of sensitive information through secrets

.github/workflows/golangci-lint.yml.purpose: Configuration file for golangci-lint GitHub Actions workflow

.github/workflows/sentry.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for Sentry release management.
side_effects: Triggers on release events
Uses secrets for sensitive information
risks: Exposure of sensitive information if secrets are not managed properly

cmd/app.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for setting up the main application, including an HTTP server and a metrics server, along with middleware for logging, error handling, and monitoring.
cmd/app.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where the main application logic is encapsulated in a single entry point (main.go) that initializes and manages various components such as servers and middleware.

cmd/app/main.go.purpose: This file sets up an HTTP server and a metrics server, handles graceful shutdown, and integrates middleware for logging, error handling, and monitoring.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking if enabled
Starts HTTP and metrics servers
Handles OS interrupt signals for graceful shutdown
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs if not properly configured
Improper error handling could lead to application crashes

cmd/clean_cronjob.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for implementing a command-line application that cleans old cron jobs related to announcements.
cmd/clean_cronjob.architecture: The folder follows a command-line application architecture pattern, utilizing a main entry point to initialize services and manage dependencies for cleaning cron jobs.

cmd/clean_cronjob/main.go.purpose: This file implements a command-line application that cleans old cron jobs related to announcements.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to PostgreSQL and Redis databases
Logs process time and errors
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information through logs
Error handling may not cover all edge cases

cmd/clean_highlight_dapps.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for cleaning expired highlights from a database and logging the process.
cmd/clean_highlight_dapps.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where the main entry point initializes necessary services and manages dependencies for cleaning highlights.

cmd/clean_highlight_dapps/main.go.purpose: This file is the main entry point for a program that cleans expired highlights from a database and logs the process.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to PostgreSQL database
Connects to Redis database
Logs the number of cleaned highlights
risks: Potential database connection failures
Error handling may not cover all cases leading to untracked exceptions

cmd/clean_old_special_offers.purpose: Cleans old special offers from the database based on a specified time period.
cmd/clean_old_special_offers.architecture: The folder follows a command-line application architecture, focusing on a single responsibility of cleaning old offers, utilizing a main function to orchestrate database interactions and error tracking.

cmd/clean_old_special_offers/main.go.purpose: Cleans old special offers from the database based on a specified time period.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to a PostgreSQL database
Clears records from the database
risks: Potential database connection failure
Error handling may not cover all edge cases
Sentry initialization failure may go unnoticed

cmd/ip_location.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for initializing a Sentry client for error tracking and downloading a new IP location database using Redis.
cmd/ip_location.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, focusing on separation of concerns with distinct responsibilities for error tracking and database management.

cmd/ip_location/main.go.purpose: This file initializes a Sentry client for error tracking and downloads a new IP location database using Redis.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Logs errors and process time
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs
Error handling may not cover all cases

cmd/trigger_announcement.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for triggering announcements in a system, initializing configurations, and handling errors.
cmd/trigger_announcement.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where the main entry point initializes services and handles dependencies for triggering announcements.

cmd/trigger_announcement/main.go.purpose: This file is the main entry point for triggering announcements in a system, initializing configurations, and handling errors.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to a PostgreSQL database
Triggers an announcement based on environment variable
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information through environment variables
Error handling may not cover all edge cases

config.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for managing application configuration settings and ensuring sensitive data is handled securely.
config.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, separating configuration logic into distinct files for initialization, data hiding, and testing, while utilizing external libraries for enhanced functionality.

config/config.go.purpose: This file defines configuration structures and initializes application settings using viper for a service.
side_effects: Panic if the configuration file cannot be read
Sets global logging level based on configuration
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive configuration data if not handled properly

config/config.yml.purpose: Configuration file for a mobile wallet manager service, detailing various settings for profiling, server, authentication, logging, and other services.
risks: Exposure of sensitive information due to redacted keys and URLs
Potential for misconfiguration leading to security vulnerabilities

config/func_print.go.purpose: This file contains functions to hide sensitive data in configuration structures.
side_effects: Modifies the input data to hide sensitive information.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if the hiding logic is incorrect.

config/func_print_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for functions that hide sensitive data in maps and slices.
side_effects: Prints test data to the console
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if not properly handled

database/redis.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for creating and managing a Redis client with optional TLS configuration.
database/redis.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating Redis client functionality and metrics collection in a single file.

database/redis/redis.go.purpose: This file provides functionality to create and manage a Redis client with optional TLS configuration.
side_effects: Logs connection attempts and errors to Redis server.
Registers a Prometheus collector for Redis metrics.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if the password is logged or mishandled.
Using InsecureSkipVerify can expose the application to man-in-the-middle attacks.

docs.purpose: This folder is responsible for documentation and configuration related to the HTTP client environment settings.
docs.architecture: The folder contains configuration files in a simple structure, focusing on environment settings for the HTTP client.

docs/http-client.env.json.purpose: Configuration file for HTTP client environment settings

handlers.purpose: Responsible for handling various operations related to accounts, announcements, devices, external authentication, and other services in a web application.
handlers.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each handler file encapsulates related functionalities and operations, promoting separation of concerns and maintainability.

handlers/account.go.purpose: Handles account-related operations such as retrieving account info, linking accounts, refreshing tokens, and revoking tokens.
side_effects: Modifies the state of user accounts
Logs debug information
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs
Improper handling of authentication tokens

handlers/announcement.go.purpose: Handles announcements and preferences for a service, providing internal and public API endpoints.
side_effects: Interacts with external services for scheduling and managing announcements
Modifies preferences in the database
risks: Potential for SQL injection if input is not properly sanitized
Exposure of sensitive data through public API endpoints

handlers/binance.go.purpose: This file defines a handler for signing requests using the Binance service.

handlers/blacklist.go.purpose: Handles requests related to blacklist sites and returns them in JSON format.

handlers/common.go.purpose: This file defines a common handler for managing configurations and code versions in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies cache for common configurations and code versions
Publishes events to Redis channels
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive configuration data if not properly secured
Race conditions due to concurrent access to shared resources

handlers/dapp.go.purpose: This file defines a handler for managing decentralized application (DApp) operations, including CRUD operations and public access to DApp data.
side_effects: Modifies the state of the DApp data in the database
Interacts with external services for blacklist checks
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data through improper handling of requests
Dependency on external services may introduce vulnerabilities

handlers/default.go.purpose: This file defines a handler function to retrieve agent information from the context.

handlers/device.go.purpose: Handles device-related operations such as resetting devices, registering devices, updating push tokens, syncing addresses, and importing wallets.
side_effects: Logs information about device resets
Asynchronously initializes device registration in a goroutine
risks: Potential for race conditions in asynchronous operations
Error handling may not cover all edge cases

handlers/external_auth.go.purpose: Handles external authentication processes, including exchanging auth codes and revoking tokens.
side_effects: Sends HTTP responses based on authentication results.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive authentication information if not handled properly.

handlers/locationhandler.go.purpose: Handles location-related requests and responses in a web application.
side_effects: Logs debug information when looking up location
risks: Potential exposure of internal service methods if not properly secured

side_effects: Modifies HTTP response based on request validation and signing process
risks: Potential for exposing sensitive URL signing information if not handled properly

handlers/network.go.purpose: This file defines a network handler for managing network-related operations in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies cache for DApps and contracts based on user agent information.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive network information if not properly secured.

handlers/releasecandidate.go.purpose: Handles release candidate features and configurations for a web service.

handlers/trusted_domain.go.purpose: Handles trusted domain operations including retrieval, saving, and deletion of trusted domains.
side_effects: Modifies the state of trusted domains in the database.
May alter the response based on blacklist checks.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive domain information if not properly validated.
Possible denial of service if the input is not sanitized.

httpclient.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for providing HTTP client implementations for various services including Athena, device management, notifications, and event tracking.
httpclient.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, with each file representing a specific client interface and its implementation, promoting separation of concerns and reusability.

httpclient/athena.go.purpose: This file defines an HTTP client for interacting with an Athena service, specifically for linking accounts.

httpclient/device.go.purpose: This file defines a DeviceClient interface and its implementation for managing device-related operations via HTTP requests.
side_effects: Logs warnings for not registered devices during address synchronization.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if SecretKey is not handled securely.

httpclient/internal_client.go.purpose: This file implements an internal HTTP client with HMAC authentication for making requests to a specified URL.
side_effects: Logs request details and errors
Modifies request headers
risks: Potential exposure of SecretKey if not handled securely
Error handling may expose sensitive information in logs

httpclient/mercury.go.purpose: This file defines a MercuryClient interface and its implementation for sending notifications via HTTP.
side_effects: Logs errors if any occur during the notification sending process.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs if errors occur.

httpclient/tracking.go.purpose: Provides a client for tracking events with asynchronous capabilities.
side_effects: Asynchronous tracking may lead to race conditions if not handled properly.
risks: Potential exposure of API key in logs or errors if not handled securely.

middleware.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for implementing various middleware functions for an Echo web server application, including error handling, authentication, request tracking, and API version checking.
middleware.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each middleware file encapsulates specific functionality and can be independently used within the Echo web framework.

middleware/custom_requests_total_prometh.purpose: This file defines a middleware for tracking custom HTTP requests using Prometheus metrics.
side_effects: Registers a new Prometheus counter metric
Logs fatal errors if metric registration fails
risks: Potential logging of sensitive user agent information

middleware/error_handler.go.purpose: Handles errors globally for an Echo web server application.
side_effects: Logs error details to the context's logger
Responds to HTTP requests with error details
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive error details in logs
Improper handling of JWT errors may lead to unauthorized access

middleware/internal_auth.go.purpose: This file implements HMAC authentication middleware for validating HMAC signatures in HTTP requests.
side_effects: Modifies HTTP request handling by adding authentication checks.
risks: Potential for unauthorized access if HMAC validation fails.

middleware/network_api_v1_checking.go.purpose: Defines a middleware function to check if the API version is v1 and sets a context key accordingly.
side_effects: Sets a context key in the echo.Context

middleware/tracking_internal_api.go.purpose: Defines a middleware for tracking API requests in an Echo web framework application.
side_effects: Asynchronously tracks API request data.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive request data in tracking logs.

middleware/user_agent_parsing.go.purpose: This file provides middleware for parsing user agent strings in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies the context with parsed user agent information

middleware/wallet_auth.go.purpose: This file implements middleware for verifying wallet signatures in HTTP requests.
side_effects: Logs request information
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information through logs

migrations.purpose: Responsible for managing database schema changes and data migrations for a blockchain application.
migrations.architecture: The folder follows a sequential migration pattern, where each file represents a specific change to the database schema, allowing for version control and rollback capabilities.

migrations/20230407150000_init.sql.purpose: Database migration script to create and initialize tables and types for a blockchain application.
side_effects: Creates database tables and types
Inserts initial data into tables
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not sanitized
Data integrity risks if foreign key constraints are not enforced

migrations/20231005150000_add_announceme.purpose: This file contains SQL migration scripts to create and drop tables related to announcements, special offers, and user preferences.
side_effects: Creates tables and indexes in the database
Modifies the database schema
risks: Potential data loss if DROP TABLE is executed without backups
Foreign key constraints may lead to cascading deletes

migrations/20240111120000_alter_preferen.purpose: This file contains migration scripts to alter the preferences table in a database.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema
Changes default values
Creates and drops constraints
risks: Potential data loss during deletion
Integrity issues if constraints are not properly managed

migrations/20240206110000_add_trusted_do.purpose: Defines database schema for trusted domains and quick access D apps.
side_effects: Creates tables in the database
Creates an index on a table

migrations/20240410140000_add_dapp_highl.purpose: This file contains database migration scripts to modify the schema of a PostgreSQL database, including creating extensions, altering tables, and creating new tables and indexes.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema
Creates new database objects
risks: Potential data loss if not properly managed during migration
Schema changes may affect application functionality

migrations/20240808130000_alter_preferen.purpose: This file contains migration scripts to create and drop an index on the preferences table.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema by adding or removing an index.
risks: Potential performance impact on the database if the index is not used effectively.

models.purpose: Defines data structures and models used throughout the application for various functionalities including user management, notifications, blockchain interactions, and device management.
models.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern where each file defines specific models and structures related to different functionalities, promoting separation of concerns and reusability.

models/account.go.purpose: Defines request and response structures for user information and token management in an authentication system.

models/announcement.go.purpose: Defines models and structures for handling announcements and related notifications.
side_effects: Logs errors when JSON unmarshalling fails in ToAnnouncement and ToAnnouncement for special offers.

models/app.go.purpose: Defines data structures for code versioning and updates, including conversion methods.

models/binance.go.purpose: Defines data structures for signing requests and responses for Binance.

models/blacklist.go.purpose: Defines a request structure for getting blacklist sites.

models/chain.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for a blockchain chain model.

models/common.go.purpose: Defines data structures for common models used in the application.

models/contract.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for handling smart contract information and metadata.

models/default.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for handling responses and pagination.

models/device.go.purpose: Defines data structures for device management and requests related to devices.

models/external_auth.go.purpose: Defines data structures for handling external authentication requests and responses.

models/highlight.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for managing highlights in an application.

models/ip_locations.go.purpose: Defines data models for IP location information and request structure.

models/moonpay.go.purpose: Defines data structures for Moonpay signing requests and responses.

models/network.go.purpose: Defines the Network model and related request structures for managing blockchain network data.

models/notification.go.purpose: Defines data structures and constants for managing push notifications and their recipients.

models/preference.go.purpose: Defines data models for user preferences and filters related to device preferences.

models/quickaccess.go.purpose: Defines data models and methods for managing quick access decentralized applications (DApps).

models/ref_code.go.purpose: Defines models and structures for managing referral codes and wallets in a referral system.

models/releasecandidate.go.purpose: Defines request structures for feature management in a device context.

models/trusted_domain.go.purpose: Defines models and request structures for managing trusted domains.

models/useragent.go.purpose: Defines a structure for user agent information and provides a method to check if the agent information is empty.

pkg/announcement.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for managing announcements, including scheduling and retrieving announcements.
pkg/announcement.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating the announcement management logic within dedicated service and configuration files.

pkg/announcement/announcement_svc.go.purpose: This file implements a service for managing announcements, including scheduling and retrieving announcements.
side_effects: Uploads images to GCS
Deletes uploaded images on error
risks: Potential for file size and type vulnerabilities when processing images
Improper handling of context may lead to resource leaks

pkg/announcement/config.go.purpose: Defines configuration structures for an announcement service, including communication, storage, and Kubernetes settings.

pkg/binance.purpose: Handles Binance-specific functionalities including configuration and signing payloads.
pkg/binance.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration and service logic related to Binance.

pkg/binance/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for Binance with a private key.

pkg/binance/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for signing payloads using ECDSA.
risks: Potential exposure of private key if not handled securely.

pkg/blacklist.purpose: Responsible for managing blacklisted sites and feature flags based on user agent information.
pkg/blacklist.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration and service logic for blacklist management.

pkg/blacklist/config.go.purpose: Defines configuration structures for managing blacklists and feature flags.

pkg/blacklist/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for managing blacklisted sites and feature flags based on user agent information.

pkg/crypto/hmac.purpose: Responsible for HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) functionality, including signing and validation with support for configuration and clock skew management.
pkg/crypto/hmac.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating HMAC-related functionalities and tests within dedicated files, promoting separation of concerns and maintainability.

pkg/crypto/hmac/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for HMAC with normalization of whitelist addresses.

pkg/crypto/hmac/funcs.go.purpose: Provides HMAC signing functions using SHA256 and SHA512 algorithms.
side_effects: Modifies the order of parameters for signing
Generates HMAC signatures
risks: Potential for timing attacks if not implemented securely
Improper handling of keys may lead to security vulnerabilities

pkg/crypto/hmac/funcs_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for HMAC signing functionality

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac.go.purpose: Provides functionality for HMAC signature validation with clock skew allowance.
side_effects: Prints error messages to console
risks: Potential for time-based attacks if clock skew is not properly managed

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for HMAC validation functions, checking clock skew and signature validation.

pkg/crypto/hmac/init.go.purpose: This file initializes a singleton instance of the HMAC structure with a configuration.
side_effects: Initializes a global instance of HMAC
Sets global configuration
risks: Potential race conditions if InitInstance is called concurrently without proper synchronization

pkg/dapp.purpose: Responsible for managing decentralized applications (dApps) including configuration, service management, and CRUD operations.
pkg/dapp.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, focusing on modular service definitions for handling dApp functionalities.

pkg/dapp/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for a decentralized application.

pkg/dapp/d_app_svc.go.purpose: This file defines a service for managing quick access decentralized applications (dApps) and highlights, including CRUD operations and caching mechanisms.
side_effects: Publishing messages to refresh cache asynchronously

pkg/device.purpose: Responsible for managing device-related services and configurations.
pkg/device.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating device management functionalities and configurations in separate files.

pkg/device/config.go.purpose: Defines configuration structures for device services.

pkg/device/service.go.purpose: This file defines a service for managing devices, including operations like getting, resetting, and creating devices.

pkg/gcs.purpose: Responsible for interacting with Google Cloud Storage, including file upload, deletion, and retrieval.
pkg/gcs.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture, encapsulating configuration and service logic for Google Cloud Storage operations.

pkg/gcs/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for Google Cloud Storage.

pkg/gcs/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for uploading, deleting, and downloading files from Google Cloud Storage.
side_effects: Interacts with Google Cloud Storage
Logs errors using zerolog
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if file URLs are not properly secured

pkg/helper.purpose: Provides various utility functions and helpers for encryption, file handling, random string generation, and Ethereum address normalization.
pkg/helper.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each file encapsulates specific functionalities related to helper utilities, promoting reusability and separation of concerns.

pkg/helper/aes.go.purpose: Provides functions for AES encryption of messages using a specified key.
side_effects: Generates random initialization vector (IV) for encryption.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if the key is not managed securely.

pkg/helper/binder.go.purpose: Provides functionality to bind multipart file uploads to struct fields in an Echo web framework context.
side_effects: Modifies struct fields based on multipart file uploads.
risks: Potential for denial of service if large files are uploaded.
Improper handling of file types may lead to security vulnerabilities.

pkg/helper/hmac_token.go.purpose: Generates an HMAC access token for authentication purposes.

pkg/helper/pointer.go.purpose: Defines a generic function to create a pointer to a value of any type.

pkg/helper/random.go.purpose: Generates a random string of specified length using alphanumeric characters.

pkg/helper/ronin.go.purpose: Provides utility functions for normalizing Ethereum addresses, hashing messages, and validating signatures.
risks: Potential for signature forgery if inputs are not properly validated.

pkg/helper/slice.go.purpose: Provides utility functions for manipulating slices, including filtering, finding index, converting slices to maps, and mapping elements.

pkg/helper/tls.go.purpose: This file provides a function to convert given certificate and key data into a TLS configuration.

pkg/location.purpose: Responsible for managing IP location data and providing services related to it.
pkg/location.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration and service logic related to IP location management.

pkg/location/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for the application, including database URLs and file names.

pkg/location/location_svc.go.purpose: Provides a service for retrieving IP location data and managing the database of such data.
side_effects: Downloads and saves a new IP database file.
Publishes a message to a Redis channel to refresh the IP location database.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if the IP database is not secured.
Error handling may not cover all edge cases leading to application crashes.

pkg/moonpay.purpose: Responsible for handling configuration and services related to Moonpay, including URL signing.
pkg/moonpay.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration and service logic in separate files.

pkg/moonpay/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for Moonpay with a secret field.

pkg/moonpay/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for signing URLs using a configuration.

pkg/preference.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for managing user preferences related to a wallet application, including fetching, updating, and syncing preferences based on device and address.
pkg/preference.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating the logic for user preference management within a dedicated service file.

pkg/preference/pref_svc.go.purpose: This file defines a service for managing user preferences related to a wallet application, including fetching, updating, and syncing preferences based on device and address.
side_effects: Logs information and errors during preference migration and updates.
Asynchronously migrates notification settings for devices.
risks: Potential for unauthorized access if device IDs or addresses are not properly validated.
Error handling may expose sensitive information through logs.

pkg/releasecandidate.purpose: Responsible for managing feature configurations and whitelist devices for mobile wallet candidates.
pkg/releasecandidate.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, utilizing Redis for state management and providing a clear interface for feature access control.

pkg/releasecandidate/init.go.purpose: Defines a service interface for managing feature configurations and whitelist devices.

pkg/releasecandidate/service.go.purpose: Manages feature access for mobile wallet candidates using Redis for state management.
side_effects: Modifies Redis state for feature access and whitelists.
Logs information and errors during execution.
risks: Potential race conditions when accessing shared resources.
Improper handling of Redis errors may lead to incorrect feature access.

pkg/tracking.purpose: Responsible for tracking events and requests, providing services to manage and process tracking data.
pkg/tracking.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration, data models, and service logic related to tracking functionality.

pkg/tracking/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for tracking with associated methods.

pkg/tracking/models.go.purpose: Defines data structures for tracking events and requests.

pkg/tracking/tracking_svc.go.purpose: Provides tracking services for events using a tracking client.
side_effects: Modifies event data if certain conditions are met.
Makes network calls to track events.

pkg/trusteddomain.purpose: Responsible for managing trusted domains, including caching and database operations.
pkg/trusteddomain.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture, encapsulating domain management logic and utility functions.

pkg/trusteddomain/trusted_domain_svc.go.purpose: Provides a service for managing trusted domains, including caching and database operations.
side_effects: Caches results to reduce database load
Subscribes to a Redis channel for cache invalidation
risks: Potential race conditions in cache management
Error handling may not cover all edge cases

pkg/trusteddomain/utils.go.purpose: Generates wildcard domain names from a given domain string.

pkg/worker.purpose: Responsible for managing a pool of worker goroutines to process jobs concurrently.
pkg/worker.architecture: The folder follows a concurrent processing architecture using goroutines, with a dispatcher managing worker pools and job execution.

pkg/worker/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for a worker package.

pkg/worker/dispatcher.go.purpose: This file implements a dispatcher that manages a pool of worker goroutines to process jobs concurrently.
side_effects: Starts goroutines for workers
Blocks on worker availability
risks: Potential deadlock if jobQueue is not managed properly

pkg/worker/job.go.purpose: Defines a Job type with an executable function.

pkg/worker/worker.go.purpose: This file defines a Worker type that manages job execution in a worker pool.
side_effects: Starts a goroutine for job processing
Modifies the WaitGroup state
risks: Potential deadlock if not managed properly with WaitGroup

pkg/xauth.purpose: Responsible for client authentication and external authentication service integration.
pkg/xauth.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating authentication logic and configuration management.

pkg/xauth/config.go.purpose: Defines configuration structures for client authentication.

pkg/xauth/external_auth_svc.go.purpose: This file implements an external authentication service that exchanges authorization codes for access tokens.
side_effects: Logs an error if unable to exchange auth code.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if error handling is not properly managed.

repositories.purpose: This folder contains repository definitions for managing various entities in a database, including announcements, code versions, contracts, decentralized applications, highlights, networks, user preferences, quick access DApps, and trusted domains.
repositories.architecture: The folder follows a repository pattern, where each file defines a specific repository interface and its implementation for managing different entities, utilizing GORM for database interactions.

repositories/announcement.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing announcements, including CRUD operations and special offer logs.
side_effects: Database transactions for creating, updating, and deleting announcements and special offers.
risks: Potential SQL injection if query parameters are not properly sanitized.

repositories/code_version.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing code versions, including retrieving and saving versions to a database.
side_effects: Database transactions are performed which may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if inputs are not properly sanitized.
Error handling may expose sensitive information.

repositories/common.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing common entities in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized.
Data loss if 'overwriteOnConflict' is not handled correctly.

repositories/contract.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing contract data in a database.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential for SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized.
Panic calls in unimplemented methods may lead to application crashes.

repositories/dapp.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing decentralized applications (DApps) in a database.
side_effects: Database operations that modify the state of the database.
risks: Potential SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized.
Panic calls in unimplemented methods could lead to application crashes.

repositories/highlight.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing highlights in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions for creating, updating, and deleting highlights.
risks: Potential SQL injection if input is not properly sanitized.
Data integrity issues if concurrent updates are not handled correctly.

repositories/init.go.purpose: Provides pagination functionality for database queries using GORM.

repositories/network.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing network entities in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized.
Panic in SaveNetwork, UpdateNetworks, and SaveNetworks if not implemented.

repositories/preference.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing user preferences in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database operations that modify user preferences.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized.

repositories/quickaccess.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing Quick Access DApps, including CRUD operations and search functionality.
side_effects: Database transactions are performed which may modify the state of the database.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized in search queries.

repositories/trusted_domain.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing trusted domains in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized in queries.

root.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for the wallet-manager project, including configuration, documentation, and service definitions.
root.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, organizing configuration, documentation, and service definitions for a Dockerized application.

.golangci.yaml.purpose: Configuration file for GolangCI-Lint, specifying linter settings and rules.

SECURITY.md.purpose: Document the security policy and supported versions of the project.

country_iso2_to_currency.json.purpose: Mapping of country ISO2 codes to their respective currencies

country_iso2_to_iso3.json.purpose: Mapping of country ISO 2-letter codes to ISO 3-letter codes.

docker-compose.yml.purpose: Defines services for a Docker application including PostgreSQL and Redis.
side_effects: Creates Docker containers for PostgreSQL and Redis services.
risks: Exposing database ports to the host may lead to unauthorized access if not secured.

entrypoint.sh.purpose: This script serves as an entry point to run a service application.
side_effects: Executes an external application './app' with passed arguments.
risks: Potential execution of untrusted code if './app' is not secure.

routes.purpose: Responsible for setting up and managing routes for an Echo web server, including public, private, and internal API endpoints.
routes.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, organizing routes into separate files for public, private, and internal APIs, allowing for clear separation of concerns and easier maintenance.

routes/init.go.purpose: Sets up routes for an Echo web server and initializes various services and repositories.
side_effects: Establishes database connections
Initializes various services and repositories
Logs fatal errors if database connection fails
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive configuration data if not handled properly
Database connection errors could lead to application crashes

routes/internal.go.purpose: Defines internal routes for a wallet manager API, handling various network and announcement functionalities.
side_effects: Modifies the state of the API by registering routes and middleware.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if routes are not properly secured.
Improper handling of user input could lead to security vulnerabilities.

routes/private.go.purpose: Defines routes for private wallet management operations in an API.
side_effects: Modifies the state of the Echo router by adding new routes.

routes/public.go.purpose: Defines public routes for a wallet manager API, including health checks and various resource endpoints.
side_effects: Modifies the state of the API by registering routes and handlers.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information through improperly secured endpoints.

tests.purpose: This folder contains tests for the web server that provides an endpoint to sign messages using ECDSA.
tests.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, focusing on the implementation of a web server with specific functionalities related to ECDSA message signing.

tests/main.go.purpose: This file implements a web server that provides an endpoint to sign messages using ECDSA.
side_effects: Starts an HTTP server
Listens for OS interrupt signals
risks: Potential exposure of private keys if not handled securely
